text:
Angel Beat Workshop, Choose Innovative & Manageable Solutions - Monday, September 28, 2015
Organizations of all sizes can overcome hostile technology environments and challenges, through Mavenspire's broad portfolio of scalable solutions that protect data and deliver rapid recover-ability across physical, virtual and cloud environments. Registration is now open for this unique September 28th event at http://www.mavenspire.com/angel-beat/ Let us help you ensure the success of every recovery.
Annapolis, MD, September 25, 2015 --( PR.com )-- In light of Septemberâ€™s National Safety Month, Mavenspire will sponsor an informative day of workshops and classes discussing disaster recovery and business continuity services for organizations on September 28 from 7:30am - 4:00pm.
Today, organizations of all sizes struggle with viable data protection solutions for an increasingly hostile technology environment. With many disaster recovery and business continuity options to choose from, it can be difficult to choose the right cost-effective and manageable solution for a company.
Mavenspire will discuss how organizations of all sizes can meet this challenge, through its broad portfolio of scalable solutions that protect data and deliver rapid recoverability across physical, virtual and cloud environments. Its automated processes for validating and verifying the integrity of data helps ensure the success of every recovery.
This workshop will discuss current trends in data protection and backup, along with the importance of utilizing cloud and backup solutions in everyday business operations. Mavenspire, along with Dell Data Protection, VMware and Red Hat, will stress the value of having a common data protection platform that seamlessly and consistently covers physical and nonphysical data stored platforms.
The evening will end with an informative session with Mavenspire CEO and Founder, Michael Tanenhaus, as he analyzes the top announcements from VMware's just completed VMworld global user conference, and he will assess their impact on current and future business operations. Tanenhaus will also discuss how OpenSource/Linux has moved from "under the floor", to become the primary computing platforms in many datacenters, and a driving force behind innovation in today's software defined world.
Registration is now open for the September 28th event. Register at http://www.mavenspire.com/angel-beat/
